summary: quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-qPCR) assay is considered the gold standard method for detection and quantification of enteric RNA viruses such as hepatitis A virus (HAV), hepatitis E virus (HEV) or human noroviruses (NoV) worldwide, HAV infections account for 1.4 million cases annually and about 102 million asymptomatic and symptomatic cases occurred all together in 2013. the use of wild-type bacteriophage MS2 instead of MS2 PLP has two disadvantages. wild-type bacteriophage has the ability to proliferate – theoretically, in a specific sample such as those with fetus. the wild-type bacteriophage MS2 cannot be used as a highly specific PCV because its genome does not contain the specific target sequences. the advantages of MS2 PLP include their ability to protect the control RNA contained in their capsid from degradation by ubiquitous ribonucleases and their stability during long-term storage. the control sequence with a total length of 150 bp was synthesized de novo (Elisabeth Pharmacon, Czech Republic) the specificity of the control sequence was verified using BLAST1. it was also analyzed using OligoAnalyzer 3.1 software2 for the ability to form secondary structures. NEBuffer 2 (New England Biolabs, UK; NEB), 100 U HindIII and 10 U BlpI endonucleases were purified using the Qiagen PCR purification kit (Qiagen) the cleaved PCR product was further purified using the QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen) purified plasmid AU2 was dephosphorylated using 0.25 U calf intestinal alkaline phosphatase (NEB) added to restriction mixture. dephosphorylation reaction was run at 37°C for 1 h. two milliliters of the culture were transferred to 200 ml of LB broth containing 30 g/ml of kanamycin. the pellet was resuspended in 200 ml of LB broth containing 30 g/ml of kanamycin. cell suspension was centrifuged at 600 g for 10 min at 4°C. intact MS2 PLP were verified by transmission electron microscopy. supernatant (1 ml) was incubated with 100 U of DNase I (NEB) and 50 U of RNase A (Qiagen) for 40 min. the purity of obtained MS2 PLP was controlled using agarose gel electrophoresis and TEM. the number of MS2 PLP was determined by UV spectrophotometry using the Avogadro constant, extinction coefficient of 0.125 mg/ml of MS2 bacteriophage per absorbance unit. the suspension containing MS2 PLP was diluted 10-fold in water. the samples were analyzed in hexaplicates and the mean and standard deviation values were calculated. RT-qPCR was used as a fourth method for MS2 PLP quantification. the DNA-containing IAC sequence and the fragment encoding the specific control sequence were prepared according to Vojkovska et al. (2015). in vitro transcription of the IAC and the fragment encoding the specific control sequence derived from thylacine and the moa bird was performed. qPCR was performed using the Roche LightCycler 480 under the following reaction conditions: initial denaturation at 95°C for 10 min, followed by 45 cycles at 95°C for 10 s, 60°C for 30 s and 72°C for 10 s. RNA in vitro transcripts were quantified by fluorimetry using the Qubit RNA BR Assay Kit (Life Technologies) and Qubit 3.0 fluorometer (Life Technologies) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. RNA from liver tissue (50 mg aseptically taken from three different inner-liver locations) was isolated using the RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen), while RNA from serum (200 l) and feces (200 l from 250 mg of feces resuspended in 2.25 ml of phosphate-buffered saline buffer – PBS) was isolated using the QIAamp Viral RNA kit (Qiagen) RT-qPCR quantity value (x) is divided by 5 to obtain the quantity of RNA molecules in 1 l (RT-qPCR uses 5 l of template RNA), followed by multiplication by elution volume (y) control sequence was derived from mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) sequences of two extinct species. RT-qPCR was used as a fourth method for MS2 PLP quantification. in vitro transcription of the IAC and the fragment encoding the specific control sequence derived from thylacine and the moa bird was performed. qPCR was performed using the Roche LightCycler 480 Probes Master (Roche), 5 pmol of the NP F and TM R primers, 10 pmol of the TM F and TM R primers, 4 pmol of the NP P probe and 5 l template cDNA. initial denaturation at 95°C for 10 min followed by 45 cycles at 95°C for 10 s, 60°C for 30 s and 72°C for 10 s. quantification standards were prepared from a 10-fold dilution of in vitro-prepared RNA transcripts of the fragment encoding the specific control sequence derived from thylacine and the moa bird. RT-qPCR assays can be performed to detect various types of enteric RNA viruses. the exact number of MS2 PLP added to samples (5 106 particles) was chosen according to ISO/TS 15216-1 and ISO/TS 15216-2. extraction efficiency from serum matrix (77.04%) is almost 10-fold higher than extraction efficiency from feces (8.77%). similar impact of sample composition is also obvious in swab and vegetable samples. use of PCV in RT-qPCR detection of RNA viruses is highly beneficial. this requirement is based on need to maintain sufficient supply of PCV in the laboratory. in these cases, MS2 PLPs represents an alternative approach because they can be easily produced through bacterial cultures in high quantity. this production approach of MS2 PLPs excludes the difference in virus source and provides for high quality, standardized PCV stocks. the manuscript: PV and PeK; all authors approved the version to be published in Frontiers in microbiology. authors declare that the research was conducted in the absence of any commercial or financial relationships that could be construed as a potential conflict of interest.
